Had a great reasonably priced seafood lunch special. Very crowded of cours. Say at bar. Asked for a marrtini suggestion and ended up with a 30$ gin martini so you may want to ask the price if its a concern.

review_title: Great views could be better organised
review:
There's plenty of other reviews to let you know about the great views so I will give you my views of a not well informed unorganised experience.
We tried three times to get to the observation decks only to be confronted with unhelpful obstructive staff...More

review_title: Worth a visit at least onve
review:
Paid around Â£80 for 3 of us to visit here. Did a night time visit and it was nice. Quite well organised and you can stay as long as you want. Busy so difficult to get lots of pictures but there are various options.
Gift...More
This was quite expensive for a family of four but I canâ€™t argue that the views of Manhattan are just fantastic.

We visited at night and the view was spectacular. Staff were reasonably nice. Bar is not open to under 21s. Elevator took around 30secs and travelled so fast, ears popped. There are 3 levels and the highest has quite a low barrier.
It was busy, couldnâ€™t get tickets before 10:45pm and once up, it was packed. It was 150$ usd for a great view but in all, the experience was not worth the money.

We got our sightseeing pass redeemed quite quickly but had to wait 2 hrs to for our queue. I just want to keep you guys head up. They will try to stuff the brochure right in your hand. They will not ask would you like...More

Don't get me wrong, the views from the top are amazing, but the whole process of getting up there is a big hassle. It's very much like trying to get on a very popular ride at Disney world. The staff was very unfriendly. They won't...More

review_title: Not a patch on Empire State!
review: Observe the city from the 62nd floor, there are some sights to see but you see much more from the 102nd at the Empire State. There is an interesting exhibition on the way in which has some iconic images such as the men sat on...More
The view is breathtaking. Like most NY attractions, they beat around the bush to charge you 45 dollars to go up 67 floors.

This attraction packs the crowds in day in and day out and while it does give you a great view atop New York going up to Top of the Rock I could only think of the money rolling in for the not-impoverished Rockefellers. If you've...More

review_title: ok view, good place to get a drink
review:
Always a nice stop to take people from out of town.
Ok view , good place to catch up with friends at the bar

review_title: Too expensive for what it is..
review:
38USD/head is pricey!
Ladies selling tickets could be friendlier, however we had an awesome lift concierge who wanted to chat with all in the line and ask where we were all from which was lovely.

With a pre-paid ticket with a designated time, I foolishly thought that this attraction wouldn't be quite such a tiring experience. Wrong. An hour and 5 min wait before we got to the deck. Nice views and not difficult to find a place at the...More
Recently visited with my wife and children. The observation deck was only open on one of its levels yet they kept adding more and more people to the crowds. Way over priced for the experience.
Of the 2, I prefer the Empire State Building. It had incredible view and history. Top of the rock felt a bit soulless. Just a high rise with good view. We did it at night and empire during day.

I love views of the Manhattan skyline, so I shelled out the $32 to go up to the Top of the Rock on a visit to Manhattan last June.
But the crowd was so incredibly dense and the wait so long and tedious that I...More

review_title: Ok view. Don't bring a pen knife or they will take it at security
review: Decent views without having a chain link fence in your face. Obviously tourist gawking is an afterthought to cash in. Small elevators and long lines during popular times. They manage it ok. Security will take your small pen knife, so don't forget to empty your...More

1st of all the views are stunning , especially looking at empire state . but the overall organisation is terrible . the cafe / shop area is nowhere near big enough for the amount of people it attracts . there ate only 2 seating areas...More

I liked the view better than what the Empire State Building offers.
However, I believe they missed an opportunity to help people understand what they're looking at. When you get to the observation deck, you can see a lot. Unfortunately, they don't hand out a...More

So the view itself is amazing, however, the experience getting to the view sucked.
We are visiting during a very busy time of the year and bought tickets for 7:40PM. Outside it was cold, but inside it was steaming hot. I thought we would buy...More
Long queues to get in, about an hour from the door to the viewpoint. Queues to get in, but even to get out! It needs someone to get this sorted out. The views are only great when you get a clear day.

It seemed like a lot of money to be shepherded around a lot of lines and shouted at to stayed squished up
To people in those lines. Wouldnâ€™t do it again.

review_title: The staff were lovely, the views great, but security was obnoxious
review: The welcoming was warm, and each of the young staff was friendly and positive. The lift up was fun, and the views great - as you'd expect. The only off moment was the security downstairs, when the supervisor (?) - a white guy aged 50+...More

We have being & done it, wouldn't go back!! If I was to recommend it would to do this in the evening when it's going dark.
Luckily there was only a 10 minute queue for this... Anymore & it would have been even more disappointing....More
This was our second visit to Top of the Rock. Our last one in 2014 was amazing starting with ride in lift. This time it was very disappointing. The view was great.

The view from top of the rock is better than the empire state building, however, the queues are awful, we went at a fairly quite time and we spent well over an hour going through 5 queues add we skipped the first queue as we'd...More

Even though you pre book passes, you must line up to reserve a time slot. We started lining up at 10:00 in the morning and the line up was out the door and about 20m up 50th street.
The next earliest we could go up...More

review_title: Top of the Rock- Cold and windy night
review: The Top of the Rock wasn't what I really expected. However, I feel that the time of day we went hampered the true experience of Top of the Rock. Felt it should have been half the price.

We arrived at the Rockefeller building without having bought our tickets in advance. The lady at the cash was absolutely rude and unfriendly. Why do you work in a public setting with tourists if you don't like people is always a mystery to me.
Fortunately,...More

The view from the Top of the Rock is incredible, the journey up 60+ floors at such speed is a lot of fun (get ready for your ears to pop!) and the views when you get there are stunning. The fact that it has an...More

Although it was great to get a pre assigned time to go up and the view was amazing in my opinion they let too many people up at the same time and it was hard to get a great spot for photos of the Empire...More

We have done the Empire State on past visits so tried Top of the Rock this time. We had a New York Pass so it was basically free... in my opinion not worth paying $34 a head for. Very pretty at night but you can't...More

We bought city pass tickets online before the trip and when we got there, my mother pulled it up on her phone and the guy helping us totally had a rude reaction to it. We took the tour which was basically a video about the...More
It was indeed a great view. Pretty high price to stand in crowds and look at the city. I think that all things highly rated on TA are probably crowded now.....

Great sights of New York especially the Empire State which can be seen even on a bad day. Various levels to see the sights. Enjoyed the lift ride which is a lift with a clear roof and the shaft had blue lights to emphasise the...More

review_title: Nowhere near as good as Empire state
review: First time in Manhattan New York for us so we wanted to do everything. This is quite disappointing. Tatty building inside No proper observatory like Empire state and world trade centre. Too many people on roof at any one time. If you don't get time...More

review_title: Good view, but pricy and crowded
review: One of the major viewpoints over Manhattan, and the only one that has the option of an unobstructed view for your camera (no glass windows on the top decks). But very crowded, even with timed tickets, and expensive.

review_title: Ok view of new York city
review:
It was a good view of manhantten.
We went during the day, it may be better to go at night.
I have been atop CN tower in toronto, space needle in seattle, harbor tower in vancouver. They are all like. Good view if empire state....More

review_title: Great views from the top of the Rock
review: The views can't be beat, and because tickets are timed the process to get upstairs to the top is quite efficient. I am giving it an average rating because it's very much a one and done type of thing. Go to top, wait to take...More
Quite overrated. Only went as it was included in the New York Pass. Prob wouldn't visit again if in New York.

review_title: Not as good as Empire State building. Crowded at dusk/night time.
review: Unless you have admission using the NYC Pass, I felt this attraction was not as good as the Empire State building observation. So many people, many who are inconsiderate when it comes to taking their picture and moving on so others can do the same....More

We thoroughly enjoyed the views here but it would be helpful if they provided a written guide/illustration to show the famous landmark names from various vantage points.
The queuing system and crowd control worked well.

I had been told that this was one of the best vantage spots to see New York in all its, ergh, glory. And I suppose it is, if you can dodge all the tourists - especially those with selfie-sticks (which really should be banned). The...More
Great views, but nothing more. Don't waste your time on the tour unless you are a historic architect.

review_title: Much better than the Empire State Building
review: I took advice on this excursion and was really glad I did having heard stories from those who did the same thing but on the Empire State Building. Brilliant views of the city, particularly Central Park & the Empire State Building. Limited view of Chrysler...More
Been there twice. Great for those who love new York Manhattan and are curious. Binoculars poor. More security guards not enough guides. It's okay to do it

The views were amazing but we had a long wait to get up there although the staff were great due to sheer volume of visitors
Personally we felt the attraction expensive as after you had looked round from every angle you were ready to leave

We had to go back twice, once to book tickets and then another time to go up. You have to line up to get tickets and then line up to go, unfortunately the day we went it was a four hour wait to go up....More

review_title: Nice view but rude staff at Upper Deck
review:
During my trip in NY I had the occasion to visit both the Top of the Rock and the Empire. Of course the Empire has a superior view and great staff from the ground to the top, kindness and professionalis.
I cannot say the same...More

$135 for a family of 4 to essentially take a long elevator ride? Way too expensive, in my opinion. However, there is no wait, so if you are willing to fork out the cash, at least you can get to the top fast.

The view from the top at night was pretty good but by the time we had got there we were frankly a a bit fed up with all the hype. We only had a to wait an hour for our allotted time slot,so went a...More

review_title: Too crowded to enjoy the view.
review: The online ticketing process was fine. The guard allowed us to enter early since the kids were tired. Once we got to the top, the crowd was 3 or 4 deep so you couldn't enjoy the views. All in all, not worth it in the...More

review_title: Loved the view but hated the lines
review: Even with our NY City Passes we had to wait too long in line even though we had an assigned time. Passing time in Rockefeller Centre wasn't fun either because it is gloomy and close inside. However, the views are spectacular once you get up...More

Typical touristy spot. Emplyees were on their phones and could care less about your experience. We rode up on elevator and the hostess was so busy on her phone she didn't tell us where to go. We all had a good laugh when we realized...More

review_title: What a view dispite the rain.
review: Surprising that we were able to see the Empie State Builiding. If it wasn't for the rain, would have seen much further. Its amazing seeing all the high rise and there is a park in the middle.

Went up the tower with my kids at night. The view is spectacular, especially at night. For a family, it is very expensive (175$ for five people). Expect a long long wait to go up and a bit of a wait to go down.

review_title: Busy & crowded but a must do
review:
Expect to queue, and expect to be surrounded by masses!
Amazing views, nice that you can see the Empire State Building. Lift takes 40 seconds and has a glass ceiling (I couldn't look!!).
It was OK, and a NY must do but I wouldn't Be...More

Fantastic views across the city. Went up to see the sunset with a few thousand others lol. Was really hoping to soak the breathtaking views in but spent an hour just stood behind people hogging all the good photo spots. Was frustrating but I guess...More

review_title: World class view compensates for second class experience
review: Not a great time being hurded up and down the tower and the observation levels were packed 3 deep with people who clearly weren't intending to give up their view any time in the foreseeable future. However with elbows and tenacity we eventually got to...More

review_title: Great views if you can go on a sunny day
review: It does have great views, and they are pros at moving a lot of people efficiently up/down elevators.
Having gone to the Empire State the day before, this attraction was just ok. It did offer great city views, but that is about all you get.

review_title: Good but way too much people
review: The view is great, expensive but great. On the last level, the terrace, there are like 20 persons per square meter and you have to fight to get a photo !
Yes it's good, but since there is the trade Center... I can say it's better only since you can be outside

Compare to other views it's not the best in my opinion. May be if you go by the sunset or night time. The north view is one of the nicest of all though and the advantage of having the ESB just very close make worth...More

This attraction needs to be booked at the Rockefeller Centre where you need to select a time slot. I can't really see that this makes too much difference in reality because there is no real limit to the length of time you can remain on...More

Using our NY Pass we foolishly turned up around 7pm to get sunset in at the Rock leaving an hour and a half in case it was busy. Mistake there, the NY Pass which advertises fast track only gets you to the ticket box slightly...More
Beautiful views of the city. However, even with being New York, I was amazed at how many people they allowed up there at once. A little too crowded for my taste.

Very beautiful sightseeing from the top! However, standing in line for 1hr 25min was way too much! Wanted to go back and see it again at night, but the idea of standing a long line again quickly changed our minds!

review_title: Good but the Empire State is probably better
review: This gives a good view especially over Central park but I think the Empire State is a better view and a better experience so if I had to choose I would do the Empire State over the Top of the Rock.

We managed to get through in about a hour from getting ticket to leaving. View is great. We didn't go at night but I guess they say night and the city lights is better. We had NY City passes. This gets you in but you...More
Was a little disappointed by this attraction. Yes, you get a good view of the city but, the top of the Empire State building and One World is MUCH better!

review_title: Too many people at one time
review:
I visited Top of the Rock for the first time 12 years ago and much preferred my experience then to this time around. Both times I'd been up in the evening to get a good view of Manahattan at night.
We had to go in...More

Great views of Central Park and the Manhattan Skyline. As a venue it isn't too busy with lots of space to find a good spot for a view and photo.
The only bad point is the amount of queuing that you have to do! When...More
Lets see I had a City Pass and I thought having my pass would help with the waiting time. It may have by 30 mins. Well all and all it was a beautiful site.. I do suggest to go after 11 am.
This place kept changing our time to go up and shoving us in elevators and long lines. Not very smooth. The view however was spectacular. We ate lunch in the outside cafe and it was very good.

review_title: Top of The Rock. New York
review:
Ok. So once you get to the building you are directed away to another area to purchase your tickets. One line for cash and one for cards so make sure ur in the right one as the staff are not that cooperative.
Now you have...More

We went in June & booked for the sunset which was 7:30pm onwards. Yes, the views are amazing. But people become a little crazy hogging spaces & not budging to allows others to take pictures. A real shame as it ruined the experience

We brought the kids here because it was recommended over the Eiffel Tower. There were no lines, and a great view of the city. However, it took about 15 minutes total, and the kids were left wondering why we went.. All in all, a quick...More

review_title: Fabulous view but just too busy
review:
Went to see the sunset over The Manhattan skyline - so did the rest of the world !
Would love to return when everyone else goes home ...
After visiting one world observatory and Empire State Building, I felt like it was just another tall building but my husband wanted to go to the top, so we did.

The view of Central Park is Amazing and the skyline at night cannot be beat. We had this and the one world observatory tickets and we personally liked the one world views better. It all depends on what you want to see ..

Great views no doubt the best in the whole of NYC. Sadly. Far too many people up the top at dusk. Anyone under 5ft won't see much for people hogging the views. Also the queue to get out is too draining...

review_title: Good but not a patch on One World or Empire State!
review: Disappointed with the TOTR! Views not that great & some queuing. Staff very friendly though and generally better organised than Empire, but a way behind the slick management at One World Trade Center. Ok overall but very much third place behind Empire in second and...More
Some of the que staff, lift staff and guides don't enjoy their jobs. Rude and unhelpful. However some others did demonstrate customer service and personality
Easier to get to viewing level than empire state building but not as good all round viewing. I wish they would put the final cost of a tivk5et on the advert to show the hidden tax costs

review_title: Great views. Huge views and delays to get tickets
review:
Ok we didn't book in advance, and the advertised wifi in the centre is awful so can't book there
Huge winding king slow moving queues to get a ticket
To get a time
To join queues for the elevators and more queues..
Eventually we got...More

review_title: It has a good view but it is not worth of the money they charge!
review: It has a good view but need to cut down the cost of a ticket. It is not worth that much! it took me almost 1 hour to get to the top which had a good view to all directions, however, the top is relatively...More

I made an online reservation for a specific hour of the day. We thought because we had to make a reservation that there would be a limited number of people at that time frame. They limit the time you can enter, but you can exit...More

Whilst the view is amazing, for the price it was underwhelming. After 15 mins looking at the views there is little else to do yet we are out of pocket $150.
One of those tourist things I suppose but I wouldn't recommend.
We could have visited the bar there and gotten the same view that we paid for at The Top of The Rock but the view is spectacular so I hate to complain.
The only downside to this is that they are very unorganized with their lines but the view was decent.

review_title: Great views of city at night.

review_title: Nice view, but allow half a day

review_title: Enjoyable but not a must see

I thought it was too expensive for an elevator ride. The view was spectacular but very crowded. It took us a long time to get up and down and were only at the top a short time.
Loved the panoramic views and the amazing lift but hated the queuing to get up and down. We didn't do it but might be worth the extra not to have to wait in line.

Great views but that is about it. Interesting history but not missing out if you don't go up the tower.

review_title: Check the weather before you buy a ticket!

Took the ride up to the top for the children's benefit at night, nice views but crowded and frankly way too expensive for what you get

review_title: Liked both One World Trade and Empire State Building better

Nice view of the city skyline but other than that, not much to it. Not worth the cost or the wait time in my opinion.
Great views on the roof with three levels up top to choose from. Cool interactive light show in the breezeway too. Check prices before you go.

It's ok for taking photos ,,, lift was really good ,, when I go back I won't be visiting this again ,, was a little expensive too

Nine of us paid $30 each to go to the top and view NYC. Some of us had not been up before so it was nice to look around the and see some of the major sights. The New Year's eve ball, Empire State building,...More

We ordered tickets through the website specific day and time, we went there at noon. Visibility was poor and white cloud covered all the scenery. Although the price we paid you could not see because of the haze surrounding landscape. Although we paid full price...More

I live in NY so I've seen it a few times with friends and family. It's not something I'd do on my own. It's beautiful to show anytime because of the city's light. It's something to do, for those who come to visit and at...More

review_title: Open space but not very high up
review: We went around 8pm so the lights were great. We would not have gone except it was part of our city pass package. As such, we only spent maybe 30 minutes total as it was very cold. I wish they had maps of the skyline...More

review_title: Fab views if you can find a gap between the crowds.
review: They squeeze too many on at once and so it's impossible to get to the front at the top deck to see the view and get a clear picture. Disappointed with the organisation of this part. The rest was good and staff great!
We went in the evening to the Top of the Rock. It was very busy and difficult get a good view. I think daytime viewing may have provided a better experience.
It was too foggy to see anything from the observation deck, so I rescheduled for 2 days later and again, too foggy. So we took a guided history tour that I felt rushed in and out. Wasn't worth the $$

For what it was, I thought it was expensive. Any child age 12 upwards is classed as an adult. The view is amazing and you get to see the other side of New York but, I thought the Empire State Building was better.

review_title: OK...nice views in evening...otherwise, may not be worth the wait
review: Nothing compares to the views from the Twin Towers....prefer the Empire State Building experience to the Rock Center deck...Marriott has decent views too (and a bar). If you've never been to Manhattan, add a star.

The place where you get to see the historic buildings

Having been to the twin towers on a number of occasions I was disappointed. The best part was going up and back down in the lift as it felt as if you were flying.

review_title: Nice staff but don't buy the photos

We visited the Top of the Rock at night hoping to get some great photos of the city. The view is indeed impressive. Quite expensive tickets for what you get, though, which is no history - just an elevator ride and access to the rooftop.

review_title: Lots of waiting and expensive but great views!

review_title: Glad we did it but wouldnt rush to do it again
review: One of those things you have to see but vey expensive and we were only up there 10mins tops. Lucky it was a bit cloudy so smallish queue normally jam packed.

review_title: Check forecast , misleading info at entrance

review_title: Too long to wait to come down.
review: Perhaps because we choose the evening to visit, but the crowds were surprisingly long for what I considered to be the beginning of the off season. Be prepared to wait in line to come down if you have somewhere to be.

review_title: Wonderful views, but the rest is less spectacular
review: Unless you are obsessed with the shows filmed at Rockefeller Center, the Top of the Rock's principal attraction is its wide vista views. They are indeed spectacular, but there is little else to do there and it is not cheap.

review_title: Might be better just to splurge on a top hotel

review: Great views on a clear day with a bit of drama as you get to se them for the first time. But nothing about what this building replaced or why it was built. Usual gift shop and places to eat.

review_title: Not the view, but the tour

review_title: Not worth the time nor money

When in the big apple you have do see to believe.
Not as informative as the Empire State visit but you get a different view if the city.

Going to the top of the rock was nice, it gave you a bird's eye view of New York City.

review_title: Great view but lacking in the sevice department

review: didn't like the long lines, long wait and the accessibility in the dark on a rainy night did not help. Views are good, but not sure it is worth the rigmarole to ge there.

review_title: Top of the Rock Over the Top

review:

The Freedom Tower, Empire State, Statue of Liberty, Central Park, Madison Square Gardens etc etc etc. You can see it all !
I enjoyed the views from here more than the Empire State Building due to its proximity to Central Park. Entrance was also fairly quick and easy given current security procedures.

review_title: The best views of New York ever!

review_title: Great visit at the top of the rock

review_title: Better than the Empire State Building

review_title: Did it at Night and It was Great

It was one of our "must do" experiences of our 3 day trip to NYC.

review_title: Good evening views but a little bit of a wait.

review_title: Nice views of the Empire State Building
review: 360 deg views of the city - not as busy as the ESB. Convenient shops and eateries in the basement. Interesting architecture. No pushing,

review_title: One of those Other Big Buildings

Best view of New York skyline, central park, and beyond and of course Giovanni, what most people not from NYC, would think an Italian guy with thick new York accent would sound like with best recommendations for things to do and eat while visiting.

review_title: Better views than the Empire State Building

Loved the Top of the Rock it was spectacular & we had wonderful opportunities to take great photos. Nothing like it!
Great view of Manhattan and Central Park. Do it early on in your trip and gain a good understanding of the layout of the city.
The adventure starts from the elevator : on its roof a history of the building goes hand in hand with the history of the city is projected. On the veranda the view is breathtaking

review_title: Top of rock is too of world

review_title: spectacular view on a nice day

review_title: Loved the Top of The Rock observation deck
review: In our last trip we had gone to the Emire State observatory so this time we decided on The Rockefeller one particularly as it was walking distance from our Hotel. It was awesome.

review_title: Not cheap but a good value
review: Great views and the staff is helpful and pleasant. Children 5 and under are free. They have different levels for those who want unobstructed views and others who like the security of a glass wall. Great time.

review_title: Spend as long or as little as you like taking it all in.
review: This is a good way of taking in just how big the NYC skyline is! There are no time limits once you are up the top (three floors/both inside and outside) where you can take photos, sit, and perfect those travel selfies.

It was wonderful at night. May be even prettier in the daytime. Make reservations We had a New York Pass which included this admission.
Lovely building and nice to have glass partitions on the observation decks and not a mesh type fence like the Empire State.

Great views and unobstructed of Manhattan. In my opinion better than the Empire State Building.
I would recommend this however if you go at busy times (i.e. New Year) you will have to queue for a considerable amount of time.
Great view over NYC and Empire State Building. We could enjoy a very nice sundowner. Waiting queue was long, but all went well.
Any view of New York City is a good view, but if you had to choose between this or visiting the Empire State building I would recommend the Empire State Building.

Definitely worth the visit if want to experience NYC from above in the best way possible - from the tallest building in the skyline. We just bought the standard ticket and didn't have to wait in line. Fantastic view!

review_title: Very well run. Smooth and enjoyable
review:
We went up at night. Great views. Quite serene. The staff were friendly and helpful and made everything flow smoothly.
Would recommend.

Once you are in though it is great. Don't forget to look up when you are in the elevator!

review_title: Great views of New York City.

review_title: Great views at sunset and after dark

review:

review_title: AMazing views, but busy and loads of queing
review: We loved the views, but in the rockerfeller centre itself when waiting or afterwards, no place to sit down and the queues were horrible.

review_title: one of the most popular attractions

Went here to get a overlook over NYC. And it really was great to be able to see the view. It is easy to get lost in the "concrete-jungle", and this is a good way of getting an overview of the huge city.

From the outside the Rockefeller building is pretty meh, but the observatory is amazing. Its the best, most affordable one in the city by far and you can see all the other high rises.

review_title: Amazing view of the skyline at night!
review:
Did this instead of the Empire State Building and the view of the city skyline at night was amazing. There was a bit of waiting and faf beforehand even although we had booked in advance.

By far the best view of NY. If you like taking photos do the Empire State observatory instead of the One World Observatory, since the latter is fully glassed and talking pics without being reflacted on the glass is impossible.

review_title: Top of the Rock at night
review: Great views at night. Not being a great lover of heights it felt very safe and could enjoy the skyline from every angle.

This place is very good but cannot hold a candle to the Empire State.Worth while to visit though.Again everyone very helpful

Excellent views; crowds not as bad as the Empire State Building - a little more layed back. We really enjoyed our visit and I would recommend without hesitation. We went in Feb and it was pretty darn cold; so go prepared:)

We went in the evening and the views of the city lit up at night were fantastic.

review_title: Great way to see the city
review: We did the cheezy tourist things while in NYC and this was one stop. We had a beautiful view of the city at night, worth the price to get up there!

review: We visited on a Sunday and it was not very crowded with great views of Central Park. Views are just as good as Empire state Building with much less crowds.

review_title: If you love heights you'll want to do this

The cost is $30 and we were quickly on our way to the top. The views are outstanding in every direction you look. Definitely a MUST to see the entire city of NY.
Well organized, easily accessible be metro (subway). Great views of Manhattan. Must visit place in NYC!

review_title: Wow!!! If you want a birds eye view, THIS is it!
review: We decided to go just before dusk, so we could catch the sunset, and watch all the lights come on in Central Park and time square. This was worth the money. It was crowded towards the complete sunset, but still room to move around, and...More

We visited the Top of the Rock after visiting the Today Show. There was no crowd and the views are great. For some areas it is hard to get an unobstructed view for photos because parts of the building facade are in the photos.

review_title: Fantastic views, better experience than the Empire State Building
review: If you're into television production, you'll find the opportunity to learn about "30 Rock" an interesting experience. If you just interested in the views, you won't be disappointed!

review_title: first visit and it was worth it w/ the CityPass
review: I wasn't expecting much but it was surprisingly well run and entertaining. The view is quite good even though it's not one of the higher buildings in Manhattan. It does afford a good view b/c it's so centrally located. Not sure if I would have...More

review_title: Expensive but worth the time overall
review: Very pricy, but fantastic views of the NYC skyline at night...and cute opportunities for souvenirs and photos abound. Not sure I would do it again, but happy to have it done it this time.

review_title: Awesome views (through glass) and well priced gift shop
review: if you want unobstructed 360 degree views of Manhattan, then this is the place for you. Unlike the Empire State where you have to look out through wire fencing, the Rock has full height glass from all three observation decks. Not too much of a...More
nice view from the top. but could have been better if they have like glass type floors to enjoy the height.

We just happen to be there because we didn't want to wait in longer line for Empire. It's not tall as Empire, but you still get excellent view of the city ( central park, Liberty Statue) And you can stay as long as you like.

Buy a ticket in advance, so that you don't need to queue up. There will still be huge queues, but at least you are inside and moving. It takes about 15-20 mins from entrance to actually getting to the observation decks (at least it did...More

review_title: Maybe the best views of the city

review_title: Less Crowded on a Cloudy Day
review: On a cloudy, rainy day the lines are really short and you don't have to wait. I would go when there are occasional rain showers so that when it clears up, you are on top and you get that great view without a lot of...More

review_title: Great view of the Empire State building!
review: We planned our trip to the top of the Rock observation deck to coincide with sunset. Taking the advice of other reviewers, we arrived at the top of the Rock half an hour before sunset to get great views over Central Park etc. As the...More

review_title: Rain, rain go away... Come back another day

I preferred this a lot more than the Empire building. It was also less busy when we visited so a definately a more pleasant experience.

review_title: From here you see it all

review_title: It is always better at the Top of The Rock
review: Better than going up the top of Empire State building because you can see the iconic building. Top of the Rock also have a better time slot system that will save you a lot of time.
Great views of the city, Central Park and surrounding areas. It can get very crowded especially at sunset, got some great photos of the city skyline all lit up!!

Only negative,was rather expensive at $30 each

review_title: A bit pricey but worth it!
review: Amazing views especially of Central Park! I enjoyed the movie and history of this building as well! Great thing to do for your first visit to New York.
Loved it felt like I was top of the world, it was so high cud see all the way up to Central Park fantastic and the lift ride to the top amazing

review_title: Less crowded early morning and late night!
review:
I went to visit during Christmas 2014 and I literally went to the Top Of The Rock 3 times!! I went in the first time around 930pm and got tickets there at their booth!

review_title: A great view. Good service at the desk.

Empire State if you want that

review_title: Great view but can be crowded

review_title: Queue time is a negative point

better and cheaper than empire start building
it is highly recommended

review_title: For those who don't mind heights and lines.

review_title: Skip the lines of the ESB and come here

review_title: Great view of the Empire State Building.
review: Loved it. We went at night, and you have a great view of Central Park, as well as the Empire State from the Rock.

review_title: A great view of the city especially at night

Recommend making reservations in the evening. We were able to skip the line of tours waiting to go up.

review_title: Go when it's cold - less crowded

review_title: A great view all round the city
review: On a clear day, well worth the visit, a great all round view of the city and surrounding area. $24 to access, so choose your day well to get the best views.

review_title: I can see for miles and miles
review:
Long queues but moves very fluidly ,very well organized and a wonderful view all over new York when you finally get to the observation deck
.Definitely worth the trip and you will get some amazing photos

review_title: Top of the Rock Observation Deck
review: My daughter went here as part of her NYC trip. Brilliant view of NYC at night. Excellent view of the Empire State Building.

review_title: get there early avoid the queues
review:
great views from top and can see empire state building easily
lots of information about its history ect

review_title: Great View of the NYC Skyline

review_title: Long wait for view of the city.
review:

We come back here every time for amazing views of the city. This time we brought our young children who also really enjoyed the experience!
Really good place to begin our NYC holiday! You can see so much from the top, friendly staff too. Make sure you go early in the day to avoid the bustle

A must do whilst in NYC with amazing views of the city and central park, we had a Ny explorer pass which we just exchanged for a ticket at the ticket line, as we went early in the morning the queues were not too long.
Better views than the Empire State Building and less waiting time. Everyone enjoyed the experience, including three teenagers.

review_title: Great view on a clear summer day

review_title: Top of the Rock vs Empire State Bldg

review_title: Beautiful views, unsure about wait times

review_title: An unobstructed view of New York City!

review_title: Great view of the Manhattan skyline
review: This observation deck offers perhaps the best view of the city. We visited at sunset and it was beautiful, watching the sun disappear and the city's lights turning on is indescribable.

Brilliant attraction to visit staff all really friendly and the lift up is an experience in itself. Unsure how much it is to buy tickets for it as purchased city passes for the four of us but definitely worth a visit.
Took my daughter to NYC in June for the first time, and this came recommended and was totally worth it. We spent short time at the top, but loved the views.

review_title: Good to see New York back from on high
review: This is very well done, The elevator ride starts it all and then the great reveal sets you up for the views ahead
Beautiful view especially when the sun is going down. The views were really clear and very beautiful. A must see to those thinking about doing it.
Probably the best place to go to photograph the Empire State Building. I like the way the observation decks were organized over several levels; inside and outside, ready for all weather conditions.
very spacious views and can spend as long as you like up the top. great history of the building also.
You have to see New York from that buildind.it is better than Empire State Building.Do not make the Rockfeller tour is boring.

review:

On the reception suggested an architectural tour and we agreed.
It was a great tour and we were given a lot of facts about the designs and ideas behind the Rockefeller family.
Worth a visit

review:
Great vantage points with multiple levels. Unlimited photo opportunities. TIP: don't wait for the first spot to open up along the glass wall, keep walking around and you'll find others.

review_title: Awesome and On Top of the world
review: when you think of the time when it was constructed, it leaves you speechless at the skills of all involved. What views greet you on a clear day. You feel as if you are in NY back in the 1930's. Awesome

review_title: Great view in the middle of the City.
review:
A great Building........ beautiful design in a special part of the city any time of the year.....
you must go.

A great experience in New York. Just a exciting as Empure State Building and not so much people. Reccomend this to everyone.

review_title: Highlight of any trip to NYC!
review: Highly recommend anyone visiting NYC for the first time to make a trip to Top of the Rock. Incredible views across the city and heading up just before sundown lets you see both sides of the city.

review_title: Interesting building with great views... must see at night!
review: Great experience to visit such an iconic building and to see the view across the city of a night time... breath taking...

Situated in Midtown Manhattan, one gets the view of entire NYC, down south-the Downtown Manhattan skyline and up north-the Central Park. Best time to visit is in the evening (Sunset) to get a both the views; Pre-sunset and post sunset (Entire city lit up)

review_title: Best high rise in the city
review: Wow! That is all I can say. Views were stunning and the que was short. The lift up was special. I believe it is the best high rise in NY!

review_title: Way better than the Empire State
review: We really enjoyed this a lot more than the empire state observation deck, if you only have time for one definitely do this one.

review: I went here by reading reviews of people who preferred this tower over the Empire State: not crowded, excellent views of Central Park and Empire State and all the city. These 2 things are really worth it.

review_title: A Must See For First Visit to NYC
review: If you are coming to NYC for the first time, this is an essential item to check off the bucket list of NYC icons, Go up and see the City in its splendour, at least once (maybe not again).

The elevator is also an experience itself.

review_title: Nice place for after work time
review:
One of the best view of NY, to be visited absolutely during the night.
Price is quite expensive but worth every $.

So beautiful and surreal. Greats spot to take pictures. The view is outstanding. You will be able to see everything from 360 degrees because the deck wraps all the way around. A must for a vacation to New York!

review_title: Great View, Book Ahead of Time!
review: The view from the Top of Rock is probably 1 of, if not, the best public rooftop view in Manhattan. Plus if you plan your trip properly, you can buy your ticket ahead of time, so that you don't have to wait in line.

review_title: Awesome place to catch a sunset
review: This is an incredible place to catch a sunset or simply some amazing city views. Make sure you get there early as they sell out on for sunset.

review_title: Fantastic view and must see for your visit!
review: This is a great location to get an all around view of the city and beyond. I would also recommend the Rock Tour - a great historical tour of the area.

review_title: you just can't go wrong with top of the rock

you must visit to watch for sunset
but in order to do so, better get ticket much earlier than sunset
otherwise you will miss because of long line of ticket !,

review_title: better than the Empire state building
review:
Regularly guide friends from Europe to the Top of the Rock; often in the evening.

Wonderful you can see New York from the top and enjoy a gorgeous seen of the whole city, enjoying the weather, and a new experience

review_title: The best way to get an overview of the Manhattan skyline

Nice location for some special occasion or impressive business meeting. Recommeneded. Great martinis.

review_title: Big Apple View! Fun for anyone

Great observation platform over two levels, with good clear views of the city in all directions.

I love that you can see the Empire State Building from the Top of the Rock! Also, the lines are much shorter and its generally a better experience.

review_title: Best view of the Empire State Building.

review: Really enjoyed this, good value and offers views as good as the Empire State, and they form part of it. Newer and more luxurious inside too!

review_title: Cold and crisp but great view of NYC!

just amazing ,The rooms were clean and had everything you needed, although the rooms were small and the air conditioning was not that quiet. But for the cost they were great value!

review_title: Very enjoyable experience - great tourist attraction.
review: I had visited the Empire State Building in the past and decided to check out the sights from the 'Top of the Rock'. We were not disappointed. The restaurants at ground level provide a good choice of cuisine, particularly the fish restaurant.

review_title: One of the best views in NYC

review: Always in awe when I walk up the front steps. Always can loose yourself and step into time while viewing masterpieces. And I can think of few other places where going often for short visits is more fulfilling.

review_title: good view in a good weather

Great place to see NY, Central Park and the Chrysler building, equally fantastic by night with views all around.

My daughter and I did the tourist thing and the atmosphere and meal were actually pretty good. We even got our picture taken with an excellent view of the Empire State Building in multicolored lights. Go make a memory. It's worth it.

Beside from having already a great customer service, it is undeniably the place that offer views of Central Park and The Empire State Building like no other place does.
A great experience at a great price since you have 3 levels.
Be aware it gets...More
If you only visit one iconic site in NYC - make this one the top of your list! The views are spectacular!

360 degree view of NY City what more could you want. It was chilli up there but the view are absolutely breathtaking. Great for taking pictures. There wasn't that many people when we went which made it more personal experience.
By far worth the cost. It is unbelievable! The view is breathtaking! Even though I am not one for heights it was not scary at all!

review_title: Great vantage point of the city

Fantastic views, worth the longer queues, went up twice during visit. Fantastic pictures of Central Park and buildings, lines can be long but seemed to flow through quickly.

review_title: Want to see NYC from the Top????
review:
It's so beautiful to see New York City from the top. I would advise you to do so by night . Don't forget how beautiful NYC is by night.
Take your phone or your professional cameras & take pics........

review_title: GREAT view, line is better than the Empire State Building

Amazing view of New York - I think better than Empire State building as well. I would recommend this as a place to visit.

review_title: great place to relax and overlook the city
review: I went on the last time of the night on a Tues. It was a nice place to hang on a 75 degree night and see the city. benches to sit and plenty of room. make sure you go on all 3 levels.

review_title: Top view Top of the Rock
review:
Got to be a must do while in in NY the plus is you can take pictures of the Empire State Building, Central Park etc etc.

review_title: Great view, shorter lines than the Empire State Building

review_title: Best view from within the city.
review:

review_title: Fun and worth it - go at night!

Thi place just takes your breath away. An amazing view of the entire city. It's a bit pricey at $30 per adult, but totally worth the investment. Make sure and bring a camera, I made the mistake of only having my iPhone.

Top of the Rock offers us an incredible view of New York.
We have on one side, the Empire State Building, then the other: Central Park. It is not to be missed
:D

review_title: This is a must in New york
review: I know there is a bit of a wait and it takes a while to get to the to but it is totally worth it. The View exceptional

I'd highly recommend doing this! My colleague and I went at sunset and got the most beautiful pictures. The views really are phenomenal and it is a good idea going up this building because you get the empire state in your photographs!

Compared to other main view points, there were not many people around, queue was short.

excellent opportunity to see the whole Manhattan, but overpriced.... 30 USD for a single ticket... :(

review_title: Top of the Rock tops it all!
review: I find Top of the Rock better than the Empire State except that the latter is well known NY landmark. The views are better with glass enclosures around that will not mar the direct 360 degree views. The location is also a plus!
The views were the most spectacular in New York, much better than Empire State Building. No downside at all

I've been to NYC several times, but never managed the Top of the Rock - It was well worth the trip and provides a much prettier photograph as you can get the Empire State Building into your photos to complete the skyline. :)
Best view around. Cheaper than the Empire State Building. 3 tiers of viewing. Offers viewing behind glass as well as out in the elements for the adventurous (and warmly dressed).
An amazing spot to take in the city. Being centrally located there is a great view of all of Manhattan, from Central Park to the World Trade Center area.

review_title: After the rain, a beautiful site
review: The view from the very top has no glass in front of you so pictures are unobstructed. Can see on all directions. Great pix with Empire State Building, 1776, and Statue of Liberty in one shot.

review_title: Amazing views well worth a visit
review: Amazing views of the city well worth a visit. We had a New York Pass so I'm not sure how much it costs to visit.
I liked this more than the Empire State Building. We did the NBC tour first which was great and the views from the top are amazing
Excellent views of Manhattan, worth the money, but get your tickets in advance and expect crowds, bring your camera and enjoy the views.

review:

Great place

review_title: What an amazing VIEW of New York City

review_title: brilliant on top of the rock
review:
The Rock is well worth the $. Much cheaper than Empire
State; you go higher, see more, and the ticket is more flexible too! And you get to SEE the ESB.

review_title: An evening view of the city from The Top of The Rock
review: Still have chills reflecting on this view. I would recommend it over the Empire State Building on a clear night hands down!

user_location: North Salt Lake, Utah, United States
review: Great views from all directions - lower Manhattan, Central Park. Good place to take photos ops of the skyline. Worth the price of a ticket.

review: This is an easier option than Empire State building and has better views of the Park. Plus it's free and less crowded so you can wander around the top more easily and get better viewing. If you have seen the Empire, definitely go here.

review_title: SPECTACULAR VIEW of the entire city!
